%% Bibliography/ links

\addbibresource{/usr/share/texmf/tex/latex/biblatex-contrib/my-contrib/BIBEMME/BIBEMME_EXAMPLE.bib} % the .bib file

\renewrobustcmd*{\citet}{% this command turns author (year) to (author year)
  \@ifstar
    {\AtNextCite{\defcounter{maxnames}{999}}%
     \parencite}
    {\parencite}}
\usepackage{refstyle}

% get a hyperlink for year only citations
\DeclareCiteCommand{\citeyear}
    {}
    {\bibhyperref{\printdate}}
    {, }
    {}

\DeclareCiteCommand{\citeyearpar}
    {}
    {\mkbibparens{\bibhyperref{\printdate}}}
    {, }
    {}

\subtitle{For testing reference styles of journals in environmental microbiology
and microbial ecology\vspace{-5ex}}

\maketitle

\section*{Some sample text}

This is how an article reference looks like \citet{angel2012effectof}
and another article from the same year and first author \citet{angel2012methanogenic}.
An article with many authors \citet{boetius2000amarine}. An article
with exactly 7 authors \citet{oficteru2010combined}. Article with
only 2 authors \citet{penning2007quantification}. Same authors a
year earlier to test the order of appearance in the references \citet{penning2006carbonisotope}.
An article cited only by year \citeyearpar{vorholt2012microbial}.
Citing two references at once \citet{oremland1992importance,heckman2001molecular}.
A book chapter \citet{belnap2003disturbance}. And an entire book
\citet{fenchel1998bacterial}.
